page.title: 04Farming and Forestry
page.content: On the sides of the valley and on the bottom of the valley there is farm and forestry land.The farmland is owned by the Llewellyn family.On the opposite side of the valley there is a large area of forestry.It was once a woodland of alder,with some hawthorn and oak.A small amount of the alder remains but it is mostly sitka spruce and larch.In the forestry and on the farmland there is evidence of the coal industry.There are tracks and the remains of old levels going into the hillside.The trees from other countries are planted to grow quickly. Later they will be cut down and the timber sold. During dry weather,fires often occur in or near the forestry.
